news.title: News
news.desc: As part of the European Union project, our university was visited by Evgeni Raychev, a representative of the Varna University of Economics in Bulgaria...
news.desc1: To celebrate the 35th anniversary of granting the Uzbek language state language status and to increase respect for our mother tongue, a spiritual and educational event was held under the slogan 'My Mother Tongue is My Pride and Honor'.
news.desc2: The event 'Dedication to Studentship' took place.
news.desc3: On October 2, 2024, the Tashkent Institute of Economics and Pedagogy was visited by the Vice-Rector for International Relations of the Azerbaijan State Pedagogical University, Doctor of Philology, Professor Mohira Nagi Qizi Huseynova, and embassy representatives. On this day, a joint memorandum of cooperation was signed between the two institutions...
news.desc4: On November 5, 2024, representatives of the Heydar Aliyev Azerbaijan Cultural Center at the Embassy of Azerbaijan in Uzbekistan officially visited the institute...
news.desc5: A concert program 'Student Evening' was organized in the student dormitory of the institute. Renowned singer Anvar G'aniyev and students performed live music...
news.desc6: The International Students Day was widely celebrated at the institute. Winners of various competitions were awarded diplomas and valuable gifts.
news.desc7: The 'Rector's Cup' KVN competition took place at the institute. The 'Young Economists' team from the Faculty of Economics won the Rector's Cup.
news.desc8: Samandar Burkhonov, a first-year student of the Faculty of Social Sciences, won second place in the Uzbekistan Championship in Belt Wrestling in the 52 kg weight category...
news.desc9: Muhammadrizokhon Umarov, a second-year student of the Faculty of Economics, won first place in the Osh Open International Chess Tournament...
news.desc10: Marhabo Mirzarahimova, a first-year student of the Faculty of Social Sciences, won third place in the World Junior Belt Wrestling Championship held in Kazan, Russia.

aboutFaculty.title: About the Faculty
aboutFaculty.desc: Founded in 1979, the School of Computer Technology (SCT) is one of the oldest departments of the Eastern Mediterranean University. SCT provides education in a digital and multicultural environment with a multilingual student body...

talented.desc: Talented students are a young generation distinguished by their thirst for knowledge, creative thinking skills, high achievements, and passion for learning. They are the innovative leaders of the future and play a crucial role in the development of society.
